text: Hal Blaine (born Harold Simon Belsky; February 5, 1929 â€“ March 11, 2019) was an American rock drummer and session musician. He was one of the most known session drummers. He was known for his works with the Wrecking Crew. He also performed alongside Frank Sinatra. In 2018, Blaine received a Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award. Blaine died on March 11, 2019 at the age of 90 in Los Angeles. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American rock drummers Category:Musicians from Massachusetts Category:Musicians from Los Angeles Category:People from Holyoke, Massachusetts
title: Hal Blaine
